intro: Trigonospermum adenostemmoides, commonly known as the African star orchid, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique star-shaped blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are linear and grass-like, while its flowers are fragrant and attract various pollinators. Trigonospermum adenostemmoides is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological significance in its native habitat.
